answers.answer: Insured persons who require medical recovery, physical medicine and rehabilitation services can benefit from these programs.
answers.bResponse: Insured persons who require medical recovery, physical medicine and rehabilitation services can benefit from these programs. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services

answers.answer: Individuals can receive medical recovery and physical medicine and rehabilitation services at outpatient or inpatient facilities such as hospitals, clinics, or specialized rehab centers.
answers.bResponse: Individuals can receive medical recovery and physical medicine and rehabilitation services at outpatient or inpatient facilities such as hospitals, clinics, or specialized rehab centers. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services

answers.answer: Some examples of treatments available for patients include physiotherapy, hydrotherapy, massage, aerosols, and others.
answers.bResponse: Some examples of treatments available for patients include physiotherapy, hydrotherapy, massage, aerosols, and others. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services

answers.answer: Yes, there are some restrictions on the number of days a patient can receive these treatments. Patients have the right to specific physical medicine and outpatient rehabilitation procedures for a maximum period of 21 days/year/insured person, both in the case of children and adults. Children aged 0-18 with a confirmed diagnosis of cerebral palsy benefit from specific physical medicine and rehabilitation medical procedures for a maximum period of 42 days/year/patient.
answers.bResponse: Yes, there are some restrictions on the number of days a patient can receive these treatments. Patients have the right to specific physical medicine and outpatient rehabilitation procedures for a maximum period of 21 days/year/insured person, both in the case of children and adults. Children aged 0-18 with a confirmed diagnosis of cerebral palsy benefit from specific physical medicine and rehabilitation medical procedures for a maximum period of 42 days/year/patient. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services

answers.answer: Children aged 0-18 who have a confirmed diagnosis of cerebral palsy qualify for additional days of treatment due to their age.

answers.answer: The "Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system" states that those affected by the ongoing conflicts have access to healthcare services within the country's social health insurance system.
answers.bResponse: The "Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system" states that those affected by the ongoing conflicts have access to healthcare services within the country's social health insurance system. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/medicine-and-rehabilitation-services

answers.answer: People from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine are eligible for the benefits provided by the "Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system", by the National Health Insurance House.
